Edward Franklin Albee III was an American playwright known for works such as 
The Zoo Story (1958), The Sandbox (1959), Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? (
1962), and A Delicate Balance (1966). Three of his plays won the Pulitzer Prize 
for Drama, and two of his other works won the Tony Award for Best Play. ... His 
first play, The Zoo Story, was first staged in Berlin.
